{{EngvarB|date=December 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Bright Enobakhare | fullname = Bright Enobakhare{{cite web |title=EFL: Club list of registered players |url=https://www.efl.com/siteassets/efl-documents/efl-released-and-retained-list---2016-17.pdf |publisher=English Football League |format=PDF |page=41 |date=20 May 2017 |accessdate=6 October 2017}} | height = 1.79m | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1998|5|18|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Benin City]], Nigeria | position = [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] | currentclub = [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]]
(on loan from [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]) | clubnumber = 24 | youthyears1 = 2014–2015 | youthclubs1=[[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] | years1 = 2015– | clubs1 = [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] | caps1 = 41 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2018 | clubs2 = → [[Kilmarnock F.C.|Kilmarnock]] (loan) | caps2 = 6 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2019– | clubs3 = → [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] (loan) | caps3 = 8 | goals3 = 3 | club-update = 13:15, 3 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Bright Enobakhare''' (born 18 May 1998) is a Nigerian [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for [[Coventry City]], on loan from [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]. ==Career== ===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== Having moved from his native [[Nigeria]] to [[Birmingham]], [[England]] aged 15, Enobakhare started playing for [[Northfield Town F.C.|Northfield Town]] Juniors F.C where he was part of the team who won the [[Birmingham Minor Cup]] in 2014, scoring two goals for Northfield Town as they beat [[Rugby Town F.C.|Rugby Town]] 3–1 at [[Villa Park]].{{cite web|title=Birmingham County F.A Minor Cup 2014|url=http://www.birminghamfa.com/news/2014/may/northfield-town-juniors-win-minor-cup|website=Birmingham County F.A|accessdate=11 October 2016}} Following his success Enobakhare had trials at several clubs before joining the academy system at [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].{{cite news| title=Bright future secured!|publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C| url=http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/bright-future-secured-2552894.aspx| date=17 July 2015}} In the summer of 2015, he signed his first professional contract with [[Wolverhampton Wanderers]], scoring in a 3–2 friendly win over Chambly on his debut.{{cite news|title=Bright Enobakhare signs new Wolves deal|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2015/07/17/bright-enobakhare-signs-new-wolves-deal/|accessdate=25 August 2015|work=[[Express & Star]]|date=17 July 2015}} He scored the winner in a 4–3 friendly win over [[Doncaster Rovers]] at the [[Keepmoat Stadium]] on 2 August.{{cite news|title=Bright Enobakhare rated ready for Wolves|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2015/08/03/bright-enobakhare-rated-ready-for-wolves/|accessdate=25 August 2015|work=Express & Star|date=3 August 2015}} Four days later, manager [[Kenny Jackett]] stated that Enobakhare was going to play in the first team during the upcoming season, due to a shortage of other forwards.{{cite news|title=Bright Enobakhare has a place at Wolves|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2015/08/06/bright-enobakhare-has-a-spot-at-wolves/|accessdate=25 August 2015|work=Express & Star|date=6 August 2015}} On 11 August 2015, Enobakhare was first included in Wolves' matchday squad, remaining an unused substitute in their 2–1 win over [[Newport County A.F.C.|Newport County]] in the first round of the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]].{{cite news|last1=Campbell|first1=Darren|title=Wolves 2 Newport 1: Match report with pictures – Wolves escape cup shock|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/wolves-2-newport-1-match-9838257|accessdate=25 August 2015|work=[[Birmingham Mail]]|date=11 August 2015}} Two weeks later in the next round, he was given his debut as a starter, and scored within the first three minutes when set up by [[Adam Le Fondre]].{{cite news|last1=Dodd|first1=Christopher|title=Half-Time Report: Bright Enobakhare gives Wolverhampton Wanderers half-time lead|url=http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/wolves/league-cup/half-time-report/half-time-report-bright-enobakhare-gives-wolves-lead_241784.html|accessdate=25 August 2015|publisher=Sports Mole|date=25 August 2015}} On 29 September, he played his first game in [[The Football League]], replacing Le Fondre for the final seven minutes of a 3–0 [[Football League Championship|Championship]] win at [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].{{cite news|title=Fulham 0–3 Wolves|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34321292|accessdate=30 September 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 September 2015}} Enobakhare scored his first league goal for Wolves in a 2–1 home win against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on 23 September 2017{{cite news|title=Wolves 2–1 Barnsley|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41289624|accessdate=7 October 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date = 23 September 2017}} after replacing [[Ivan Cavaleiro]] in the 65th minute. ====Coventry City (loan)==== In January 2019, Bright joined [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on loan for the remainder of the [[2018–19 EFL League One|season]].{{cite web |title=Bright Enobakhare Joins Sky Blues on Loan |url=https://www.ccfc.co.uk/news/2019/january/transfer-bright-enobakhare-joins-sky-blues-on-loan/ |publisher=[[Coventry City F.C.]] |accessdate=8 January 2019}} ==Career statistics== {{Updated|match played 2 March 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style=text-align:center |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club
